title: Greyfriars Bobby
author: Atkinson, Eleanor
snippet: Heroes of Sebastopol answeredthe summons of drum and bugle in the Castle and fired the hearts ofEdinburgh youth. Cannon all around them, and "theirs not to reason why,"this little band stormed out Queensferry Street and went down, handunder hand, into the fairy underworld of Leith Water.

title: The works of Robert Louis Stevenson;
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: Queensferry Street lies something off the direct road to Murrayfield. But then there is the hilly cross-road that passes by the valley of the Leith and the Dean Cemetery ; and Queensferry Street is on the way to that. What was to hinder the cabman, since his horse was dumb, from choosing the cross-road, and calling on his friend in passing."

title: Greyfriars Bobby,
author: Atkinson, Eleanor (Stackhouse)

title: Solved Mysteries; or, Revelations of a City Detective
author: Macgovan, James.
snippet: It was a fine moonlight night, and hehad as usual chosen the shadowed side of the street. Hemoved along with his eyes bent on the ground till he came toCharlotte Place, a quiet and rather genteel street running offQueensferry Street, into which he turned. He did little morethan turn the corner, and then he stopped and stood lookingacross the street at a main-door house with lighted windows

title: Solved Mysteries; or, Revelations of a City Detective
author: Macgovan, James.
snippet: In going along Queensferry Street one night I saw that manof mystery on the opposite side of the street, and some distance in front of me. It was a fine moonlight night, and hehad as usual chosen the shadowed side of the street.

title: The works of Robert Louis Stevenson;
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: As he drove, therefore, he counted his wrongs, and thirsted for sympathy and drink. Now, it chanced he had a friend, a publican, in Queensferry Street, from whom, in view of the sacredness of the occasion, he thought he might extract a dram. Queensferry Street lies something off the direct road to Murrayfield.

title: By Adverse Winds. [A novel.]
author: Smeaton, William Henry Oliphant.
snippet: After crossing from Queensferry Street over Princes Street,into Lothian Road, some instinct he could never afterwardsfathom, caused him to prefer the left side of the street to theright. This was contrary to what we may term the principlesof "automatic psychology."

title: Solved Mysteries; or, Revelations of a City Detective
author: Macgovan, James.
snippet: Thus chatting, they passed along Queensferry Street, andwere soon in the quiet and stately semicircle of fine housesknown as Randolph Crescent. Bullet studied the numbers ofthe houses—mostly affixed in brass letters to the main doors—and suddenly stopped before one, pulling at M'Sweeny, whowould have passed on in blissful ignorance.

title: The works of Robert Louis Stevenson;
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: Now, it chanced he had a friend, a publican, in Queensferry Street, from whom, in view of the sacredness of the occasion, he thought he might extract a dram. Queensferry Street lies something off the direct road to Murrayfield. But then there is the hilly cross-road that passes by the valley of the Leith and the Dean Cemetery ; and Queensferry Street is on the way to that.

title: Greyfriars Bobby
author: Atkinson, Eleanor
snippet: Straight down the length of the empty market the laddies ran, throughthe crooked, fascinating haunt of horses and jockeys in the streetof King's Stables, then northward along the fronts of quaint littlehandicrafts shops that skirted Castle Crag. By turning westward intoQueensferry Street a very few minutes would have brought them to a bitof buried country. But every expedition of Edinburgh lads of spirit ofthat day was properly begun with challenges to scale Castle Rock fromthe valley park of Princes Street Gardens on the north.

title: Story of a Stolen Heir. A novel
author: Bertram, James Glass.
snippet: Sheresolved, therefore, to sing upon the streets,and trust to Providence for her daily bread. It was with trembling voice and burstingheart that poor Mysie made an effort tobegin a song in Queensferry Street; but amiUer, who belonged to the Water of Leith,happening to pass at the moment, she recognised him, and, bursting into tears, ranaway- from the spot.

title: Sunshine on Scotland Street
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: The absurd fantasy kept his mind off his situation until he had reached Queensferry Street. Now he was within yards of the office of Lothian Public Relations; he looked up at the windows of the Georgian building, at the neat panes of glass within their white astragals – one of those rooms was Jonathan's office, with its name on the door and its in-tray and its shelf with the lever-arch file of information.

title: By Adverse Winds. [A novel.]
author: Smeaton, William Henry Oliphant.
snippet: As he passed by, his tall, well-knit figure attracted the noticeof two of the night constables standing at the corner ofQueensferry Street and Princes Street. They recognised himand touched their helmets, remarking, as they gazed after him—
